description.narrative:
Due to heavy raining, the Helmand and Kandahar provinces including its districts suffered with flash floods, which demolished the homes, agricultural lands, irrigation canals, gardens, water streams, and livestock, especially, the flood prone areas. In the same time, the overflowing water flowed into the homes and partially damaged or destroyed houses, washed out the household items, NFI and belonging, as well as livestock and animal fodder. Furthermore, the houses, where they were entirely collapsed by flood, these houses# HoH could not afford to rebuild them, therefore, the family members, especially women, and children spent the days and nights in wet clothes. As a result, they were infected with different kinds of diseases facing the population health issues and challenges. Recent Protection Incidents: # In Cemetee area of Lashkergah city, due to heavy rain, a house was completely collapsed where four children were killed and two persons were severely injured. # During protection monitoring, the team monitored six houses, where the HoHs were widows and children, were completely destroyed, hence, were referred to PSN project assistance. # As they were exposed to cold and lack of shelter in Nawa district of Helmand province, thus, most of the children were suffering serious diseases. # Due to heavy rain and floods, a large number of families a homeless and leaving with no shelter. # The main harvest, expected in upcoming months, was entirely lost. # Some parts of the houses were collapsed, therefore, they needed emergency aid or shelter in order to save dependencies. # Most of HoH lost their NFIs and house belongings. # Most of the livestock were killed by flood, which further exacerbates the local economy, as cattle were used as a source of income for these families. # Overall, the privacy of the population was not conserved, due to non-availability of emergency latrines. # The bore wells were contaminated with the flood water, no proper access to adequate drinking water. # The flood-affected people were mentally and physically disturbed. # Lack of secure food and secure livelihoods made the population vulnerable.
In general, the flood-affected families were in an extreme poor situation. Most of the families were affected by the flood and lost everything, such as agricultural fields, livestock, shelters and food stocks. Due to these strains, the flood-affected families in Helmand province were yelling for emergency assistance.

participating-org.narrative:
Oxfam works to help poor and marginalized people to gain control over their own lives by exercising their right to political participation, freedom of expression and information, freedom of assembly, and access to justice. Many projects currently being executed by Oxfam in Afghanistan on women and youth fall under this campaign.
In Afghanistan, ON has been working with local NGOs, civil society organisations and networks through a number of initiatives to raise awareness about human rights, promote women's participation and leadership, and empower citizens to speak out on issues that affect their lives and to improve governance
